content: woo-wee alright crafters we are finally at the end of our project sorry it took
two videos to get here but this is a pretty pretty involved project so thanks
for sticking with it and I hope you really enjoy the final part of the
painting this is where it really comes to life so let's hit that table let's
start painting that sucker alright i spray-painted this flat black
and I'm gonna use this blue gray on it alright this is gonna be for the door so
my lid of the paint they're just gonna paint in the face all around you want to
be careful you don't get on the frame or other parts so I'm just using a
relatively smaller brush just paint it up and then once I get all the face done
oh yeah a little block at the top there once I get the face done I'm going to do
the edge so I'm going to go around paint the edge like a royal purple as pictured
in the in the artwork on the cover and then I'm going to use a burnt umber and
I'm gonna get in those little spaces between the details of the door that way
when I use my bigger brush you know I won't be slopping it all over the
details so pull that out and then I'm using the bigger brush and I'll start
applying the burnt umber um put it on fairly wet liberal amount of water add
it in there see it's coming together so I got all that and I'm gonna go around
the base with some burnt umber also and you'll see why I'm doing this a little
later not the whole base I'm not filling in
the whole base I'm just going around the details where the meets the base okay
there we go got the whole thing painted good to go let it dry yep alright now
it's dry I'm gonna use my sponge technique so this is a damp sponge and I
have dipped it in burnt sienna and I will start applying it to the sculpture
and give a nice rock texture now I'm gonna use this color called pebble which
you could use like a tan or anything like that and it gives the highlight so
I'm just kind of mix it in and back to my burnt sienna start filling that in
the lava paint was there picked it off so look at all those details were really
starting to pop out really neat really get that cliff face look very cool so I
finished it up got it all painted and really look at that I really like
the look of that looks really nice alright now I've used some lighter
purple some lavender I went around the purple the the royal purple detail of
the frame and you see it's starting to show that those runes that are on around
the edge of the door because I've highlighted it now I'm gonna use a
lighter gray for the door and do some highlights I use a little wedge of
sponge it makes it much easier to do these highlights on details like this so
just cut a wedge off the sponge there you go look at that detail pop now wow
that's amazing and just open the door get some of the edges that way you don't
get it on the purple frame and now I'm gonna use some black and I'm gonna paint
in the details this is a watered-down black you don't want to water down too
much but you want to water it down so it's not full strength black and when it
dries it'll be a nice it'll be more subtle it'll be a nice like shaded
detail on the on the artwork there we go I'll just go through the runes pick
those out they're really starting to pop out there look at that looking really
really nice you can see the runes better now around the top edge there of that
block the details of the door the face give it a nice little shadow it's really
coming to life look at that really nice oops I forgot the little blocks I'll add
some light gray to that little block there we go
looking good awesome amazing what little bit of paint can do all right now I need
some silver and you'll see why I'm doing this later
but I'm gonna put it in the eye socket there okay
all right now my dark-brown around bases dried I'm gonna use some burnt sienna
and a sponge and I'm gonna follow that around I'm not doing the whole base I'm
just going up to the edge there and now I'm going to use the pebble the lighter
color and the reason I'm doing this is I'm trying to make it look like a cliff
that's descending into the darkness all right it's kind of like kind of like an
optical illusion what I'm trying to do here so just go around the edge now I'm
going to paint the cracks so some prominent cracks on the artwork so I'm
paint the some prominent cracks into the top there which I actually etched in
with my hot glue gun so yeah I just did some beads of hot glue and then dragged
the tip through the hot glue to make those cracks there we go nice all right
now I'm gonna paint the base with some black make it darker because the sprays
never black enough for me kind of pull into the cliff so it gets that illusion
that's going to descending into the darkness all right now I have these
little oval beads I'm gonna put them as the eyes I'm gonna use white glue and
that's silver well I'm hoping what kind of shine through the the red bead you
know this semi-transparent red bead or translucent so put that on there
just push it into the foam and there you go we are set let's go to the table hey
crafters I wanted to give you a wide shot of this thing look how big it is it
compared to me it's a really large piece I think it came out really fantastic let
me give you some close-ups and we'll look at some of the details on this
piece that I really like but I really want to give you a whole view of this
thing how big it is so and here we have our little friend Roderick and put them
on there and you can see how how large it is compared to him so let's take a
closer look and we'll talk about some of the details so here we go wow this piece
is so awesome got the edging there on the platform and looks like this going
into the darkness and nice steps they're just really solid as far as the
ruction that glue just makes it really solid really hard and I really like the
cracks here these were on the cover itself and I mimicked them by using the
glue gun just dragging it through a bead of glue and painting in with some black
and just really looks like some nice cracks let's take a look at the texture
here that the paper towels and the toilet paper and the glue gun texture
just really looks nice gives it this nice rock texture and the door I think
just looks phenomenal so I put a figure up there it's very
imposing really nice and it's just so cool that extra coolness that the door
can open I just think that's so neat and so there we go there is our amage to the
dungeon crawl classics I hope you enjoyed this vid and thanks for sticking
with it hey I hope you find these tips helpful if you did give your old DM
Scottie a thumbs up and that'd be alike also check out my forum and Facebook
group a bunch of wonderful people on there and if you do like these vistas
that are tipping there is a little tip thing on the video you can click on that
and tip directly to your DM Scotty and if you want to go take it further
than that you can go to patreon and become a supporter and a member of the
family I have a monthly magazine called the crafters lair which will have
instant access to when you become a supporter take care have fun gaming
